alert.note: Alert for Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 15 at 1:30PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central Minnesota, north central Minnesota and northeast Minnesota, including the following areas, in east central Minnesota, Aitkin, Crow Wing and Pine. In north central Minnesota, Cass and Itasca. In northeast Minnesota, Carlton and St. Louis. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Multiple county, forest, or township roads will become flooded, especially those in low lying areas. Check with your county for additional information. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 129 PM CDT, gauge reports and trained spotters indicated river rises and flooding due to snowmelt. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. - Rain this weekend will increase the rate of snowmelt. The resultant runoff will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected to continue. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
